Presentation.title: Securely store your cryptocurrencies on your own
Presentation.paragraph: Our hardware wallet solution allows you to protect your cryptocurrencies for free using a USB key, an SD card, or any other external storage device you already own. Maintain full control over your digital assets with our secure self-custody solution, and simplify the security of your cryptocurrencies with our service accessible to everyone.

Advantages.title: Why use Arctic Wallet?
Advantages.bloc_p1: Securely store your cryptocurrencies and other digital assets
Advantages.bloc_p2: A free solution for exceptional savings
Advantages.bloc_p3: Easily buy, sell, and transfer your assets anywhere in the world
Advantages.advantage1_p1: With Arctic Wallet, the private keys that grant access to your cryptocurrencies are stored on external storage devices that are not connected to the Internet, such as USB keys or SD cards. This protects your digital assets from hackers and cyber attacks when you are offline.
Advantages.advantage1_p2: If your device supports it, you can enable three-factor authentication by activating biometric verification, such as fingerprint or facial recognition. To access your wallet, we verify what you boldhavebold (your external storage device), what you boldknowbold (your password), and who you boldarebold. This combination makes unauthorized access extremely difficult.
Advantages.advantage1_p3: To secure your sensitive data, we use multiple encryption mechanisms and advanced algorithms, also employed by military and government agencies. Even in case of loss or theft of your physical storage, your information remains inaccessible and secure.
Advantages.advantage2_p3_1: Unlike other hardware wallet solutions, our service requires no expensive initial purchase. You can start protecting your digital assets without investing in additional equipment, allowing you to allocate your capital to actual assets.
Advantages.advantage2_p3_2: By investing this capital rather than tying it up in a hardware wallet purchase, you avoid potential long-term opportunity costs. In the graph below, you can compare the cost of your hardware wallet based on cryptocurrency prices.
Advantages.advantage3_p1: Our goal is to enable everyone to effectively protect their private keys. Our solution has been developed to be simple and intuitive, making it accessible to everyone, from experts to beginners with no technical knowledge.
Advantages.advantage3_p2: No matter where you are, our hardware wallet solution is available to you. Since we do not sell physical devices, we are not restricted by shipping constraints, allowing you to access our wallet anywhere in the world.
Advantages.advantage3_p3: Whether you use a computer, smartphone, or tablet, our solution works on all devices. You only need a physical storage medium to securely store your private keys.

FAQ.title: FAQ
FAQ.answer_1__p1: To own an NFT, Bitcoin, Ethereum, or other crypto assets, you need a wallet. When creating this wallet, two keys are generated:
FAQ.answer_1__li1: : Comparable to a bank account number, this key can be shared with third parties to receive cryptocurrencies without compromising your wallet’s assets.
FAQ.answer_1__li2: : This key allows you to validate transactions and send or receive cryptocurrencies. You must keep your private key secure and ensure that only you know it. Anyone with access to your private key can control your cryptocurrencies.
FAQ.answer_1__p2: The purpose of a crypto wallet is to store these keys and allow you to easily interact with the blockchain. It helps you sign transactions, track your wallet balance, manage your cryptocurrencies, and use decentralized applications (dApps).
FAQ.answer_2__p1: There are different types of crypto wallets:
FAQ.answer_2__li1: : Store your private keys on Internet-connected devices, making your assets more vulnerable to online attacks and hacking.
FAQ.answer_2__li2: : Store your private keys offline, keeping them safe from Internet threats. These include paper wallets and hardware wallets.
FAQ.answer_2__p2: Wallets can also be categorized as:
FAQ.answer_2__li3: : A third party holds your private keys and assets.
FAQ.answer_2__li4: : You fully own and control your private keys and cryptocurrencies.
FAQ.answer_2__p3: Hardware wallets store your private keys offline on a physical device, providing enhanced security and full control over your cryptocurrencies.
FAQ.question_3: What happens if I lose my hardware wallet?
FAQ.answer_3__p1: If you lose your hardware wallet, you can still recover your funds using a new external storage device and your recovery phrase (seed phrase). This phrase, usually consisting of 12 to 24 words, was provided when you created your wallet and can also be found in your application.
FAQ.answer_3__p2: Be careful, as anyone with access to your recovery phrase can access your funds. It should be stored securely and only shared with trusted individuals.
FAQ.question_4: What happens if I stop paying or miss a payment?
FAQ.answer_4__p1: No worries. If you miss a payment or decide to stop your subscription, you won’t lose your funds and can access them once your subscription is resumed.
FAQ.answer_4__p2: You can also recover your funds on another wallet using your recovery phrase (seed phrase).
FAQ.answer_4__p3: This process is entirely free with no additional fees.
FAQ.question_5: Does Arctic Wallet have access to my cryptocurrencies?
FAQ.answer_5__p1: Arctic Wallet is a non-custodial (self-custody) wallet, meaning you have full control over your private keys, and only you can access your cryptocurrencies.
FAQ.answer_5__p2: Arctic Wallet never has access to your cryptocurrencies, NFTs, or other assets. This also means that if you lose your wallet or password, Arctic Wallet cannot recover your assets for you. It is crucial to keep your recovery phrase (seed phrase) secure and accessible.
